comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Ireland, Civil Registration Indexes, 1845-1958 - Patrick Joseph GALLWEY died in the July-September quarter 1901, age 41 1901 census - Patrick J GALLWEY, age 41, Medical Profession, residence Church Road, Tramore.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: That's some household: Father, mother, two daughters, a son, a governess (teacher on the census form, born in India!), a cook, a parlormaid and a housemaid. I can't make out from the OSI map where exactly 6 Church Road was, but it it must be suspiciously near what is now named Gallwey's Hill

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: In 1901, Mrs. Gallwey was 49, Roman Catholic and from Cork. In 1911, Mrs. Gallwey was 57, Church of Ireland and from Yorkshire! From [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] above, it looks as though Mr. Gallwey died the year this photo was taken. The 1911 census lists the house as belonging to one William Gallwey, though he is not shown as living there, and gives it as Number 10. The only William Gallwey in the census is a 63-year-old farmer near Clonakilty. An older brother, maybe? Mrs. Gallwey lists herself as "Wife" rather than head of the family, and her status as Married, 28 years.

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley]  I think the census House Numbers do not relate to actual house numbers. The big houses of Church Road would have names, not numbers.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/44274283@N07] You see, this's why I love Flickr! Where else would you get [http://www.flickr.com/photos/la_belle_province]'s obscure knowledge about Golf Taxidermy?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/blackpoolbeach] But this is awful! So he died just a few months after this photo was taken?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Oh, do you know, I've stopped being surprised at anything in the census. In 1911, Frances Gallwey had definitely written something, then scrubbed it out, and gone for Yorkshire. As to religion, maybe she had returned to C. of I. following husband's death?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: There were 2 different Frances GALLWEY in Tramore. Here is the wife of William GALLWEY. 1901 census, 26 Circus, Bath, Somerset Phyllis DAVIES, Head, Widow, 88, Living on own means, born in Devon, Ugborough Frances K GALLWEY, Daughter, Married, 47, Living on own means, born in Yorkshire, Adlingfleet Jannette P GALLWEY, Granddaughter, Single, 17, Living on own means, born in Ireland plus 5 female servants, all born in Somerset. www.freebmd.org.uk Marriage, March quarter 1883, Bath William Joseph GALLWEY and Frances Kate T DAVIES thepeerage.com/p39134.htm Frances Kate Trelawner DAVIES was the daughter of Reverend Edward William Lewis DAVIES. She married William Joseph GALLWEY, son of Henry Gallwey and Maria Walsh, on 25 January 1883. She died on 29 March 1938. Ireland, Civil Registration Indexes, 1845-1958 Frances K T GALLWEY died in Waterford district, 1938.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content:
Wow, two entirely different Frances Gallweys, living on Church Road, Tramore, 10 years apart?

I wonder where Patrick Gallwey's family went?

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Genealogical Findaid for Tramore shows Patrick J GALLWEY living in Albion House, Tramore. Similar results on 1894 Waterford county directory He married in Cork district, July-Sept quarter 1884, but there is no corresponding bride with given name Frances M. Ireland, Civil Registration Indexes, 1845-1958

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Here is Albion House in Streetview. That house is on Doneraile Drive now, but on the OS 25" there is no Doneraile Drive, and Albion House is on a long driveway off Church Street. Here is an undated For Sale listing for the house, which Streetview shows undergoing renovations. There is even a house there on the historic 6", which is going back a bit - 1842!

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Just in the background is the rear view of Rockfield, home of William Joseph GALLWEY, JP. Google Street View After the death of Patrick GALLWEY his family seems to vanish off public records.

comment._content: Indeed, great image.....

comment.author: 79952030@N05
comment._content:
Looks like Mrs Gallwey died 1904 see Death Register details below

Certificate No:: 269
Date of Death: 24 Apr 1904
Place of Death: Tramore
Name: Gallwey, Frances M.
Sex: F
Age at Death:53
Rank: Lady
Condition:Widow
Cause of Death: Shock caused by burns
Informant: Certificate recd. from E.N. Power, Coroner of District
Signature of Registrar:Doyle, Edmund
District: Tramore
Union: Waterford
Document Type: DREG
Notes: Inquest held 26 Apr 1904

comment.author: 79952030@N05
comment._content:
Patrick Joseph Gallwey Death Register

Certificate No:: 120
Date of Death: 11 Jul 1901
Place of Death: Albion House
Name: Gallwey, Patrick Joseph
Sex: M
Age at Death: 41
Rank: Surgeon
Condition: Married
Cause of Death: Pachy meningitis, Heart failure
Duration of Illness: 10 days, Heart failure- 36 hours
Certified By: Y
Informant: Dunning, Cath
Qualification: Present at death
Residence: Tramore
Signature of Registrar:Doyle, Edmund

Son died 6 months after the father

Rank: Child of physician
Condition: Bachelor

Certified By: Y

Residence: Tramore
